Synopsis: 
The year is 1215. King John of England (Paul Giamatti) has been forced to sign the Magna Carta. Furious, he recruits an army of ruthless mercenaries who begins to raze the country to restore absolute monarchy. Just a group of gentlemen gathered by Baron Albany (Brian Cox) and entrenched in the castle of Rochester stands between him and victory. With them, Marshall (James Purefoy), a Templar knight tormented by guilt about the atrocities committed during the Crusades, and mercenaries who are among Beckett (Jason Flemyng) and the young Guy (Aneurin Barnard). In the midst of the battle, Marshall also must deal with their burgeoning feelings for Isabel (Kate Mara), the beautiful lady of the castle and the wife of Reginald de Cornhill (Derek Jacobi). 

Production notes: 
Set in the dark and brutal XIII century, "Templar" is a story of honor and action with great verisimilitude that reflects the harshness of medieval warfare. The film portrays a crucial moment in the history of England when the signing of the Magna Carta a group of Templars led by Marshall (James Purefoy) struggling to defend their country from the tyrannical John of England ("John Lackland" played by Paul Giamatti
